injuries.shortComment: Schroder (COIVID-19 protocols) remains out Friday against the Suns, Tim Bontemps of ESPN.com reports.
injuries.longComment: Schroder will be out for a fourth straight game Friday. The Celtics will at least be getting Marcus Smart (hand) back.

injuries.shortComment: Tatum will be out for Monday's game against the Timberwolves after he was placed in the NBA's COVID-19 health and safety protocols.
injuries.longComment: Add Tatum to the growing list of Boston players in the protocols, which now stands at nine. The star forward could need to complete a 10-day quarantine before he's eligible to play again, putting him at risk of missing at least Boston's next four contests. Expect Jaylen Brown and Romeo Langford to serve as the Celtics' starters on the wing while Tatum is sidelined. Tatum previously contracted the virus last January, missing five consecutive games and then struggling to regain form upon being cleared to play.

injuries.shortComment: Fernando entered health and safety protocols Friday, Tim Bontemps of ESPN.com reports.
injuries.longComment: In one sweeping motion, Fernando, C.J. Miles, Enes Freedom and Justin Jackson entered protocols. Robert Williams and Norvel Pelle should occupy most of the team's center minutes for the time being.
